docs.snippet: Las Vegas casinos are the latest to see the New England Patriots as villains since their share of what is expected to be a record-setting year for Super Bowl wagers will increase if the Atlanta Falcons prevail....
docs.lead_paragraph: Las Vegas casinos are the latest to see the New England Patriots as villains since their share of what is expected to be a record-setting year for Super Bowl wagers will increase if the Atlanta Falcons prevail.

headline.main: Vegas Bookmakers Hope Falcons Top Patriots in Super Bowl

docs.snippet: The developer of the Dakota Access pipeline will have to present evidence at a hearing to prove the company didn't willfully violate North Dakota rules when it failed to provide details of how it planned to avoid disturbing Native American artifac...
docs.lead_paragraph: The developer of the Dakota Access pipeline will have to present evidence at a hearing to prove the company didn't willfully violate North Dakota rules when it failed to provide details of how it planned to avoid disturbing Native American artifacts during construction, state regulators said.

headline.main: Proposed Fine Against Dakota Access Company to Get Hearing
headline.print_headline: Proposed Fine Against Dakota Access Company to Get Hearing

docs.snippet: UniCredit has heavily written down the value of its 700 million euro ($756 million) investment in Italy's bank rescue fund and other investors are likely to follow suit, sources told Reuters, complicating efforts to stabilise the nation's banking ...
docs.lead_paragraph: UniCredit has heavily written down the value of its 700 million euro ($756 million) investment in Italy's bank rescue fund and other investors are likely to follow suit, sources told Reuters, complicating efforts to stabilise the nation's banking sector.

headline.main: UniCredit Writedowns Ring Alarm Bells for Italian Banks
headline.print_headline: UniCredit Writedowns Ring Alarm Bells for Italian Banks

docs.snippet: Top Senate Democrats said Friday that President Donald Trump will face strong bipartisan hurdles in Congress if he moves to change the law or guidelines that currently forbid waterboarding terror suspects, arguing that harsh interrogation measures...
docs.lead_paragraph: Top Senate Democrats said Friday that President Donald Trump will face strong bipartisan hurdles in Congress if he moves to change the law or guidelines that currently forbid waterboarding terror suspects, arguing that harsh interrogation measures are immoral and an ineffective means of eliciting reliable intelligence.

headline.main: Democrats Say They'll Fight Attempt to Authorize Torture
headline.print_headline: Democrats Say They'll Fight Attempt to Authorize Torture
